member.name: T:ZKEShop.SystemFramework.ApplicationAssert
member.summary:
A class to help with error checking and automatic logging of asserts and conditional checks.
This class works with displays system assert dialogs as well as writing to the application log with the ApplicationLog class. There is no instance data associated with this class.

member.name: M:ZKEShop.SystemFramework.ApplicationAssert.Check(System.Boolean,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Check the given condition and show an assert dialog when the desktop is interactive.
Log the assertion at a warning level in case the desktop is not interactive. The text will always contain full stack trace information and will show the location of the error condition if the source code is available.
An expression to be tested for True The message to display
The line of the current error in the function. See GenerateStackTrace for more information.

member.name: M:ZKEShop.SystemFramework.ApplicationAssert.CheckCondition(System.Boolean,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Verify that a required condition holds.
Show an assert dialog in a DEBUG build before throwing an ApplicationException. It is assumed that the exception will be handled or logged, so this does not log a warning for the assertion like the Check function, which does not actually throw.
An expression to be tested for True The message to display
The line of the current error in the function. See GenerateStackTrace for more information.
The checked condition failed.

member.name: M:ZKEShop.SystemFramework.ApplicationAssert.GenerateStackTrace(System.Int32,System.String@)
member.summary:
Generate a stack trace to display/log with the assertion text.
The trace information includes file and line number information if its available, as well as a copy of the line of text if the source code is available. This function is only included in DEBUG builds of the application.
The line of the current error in the function. This value should be retrieved by call Application.LineNumber in the parameter list of any of the Check* functions. If LineNumber is not provided,then the next executable line is used.
Returns the generated stack trace.

member.name: P:ZKEShop.SystemFramework.ApplicationAssert.LineNumber
member.value: Property LineNumber is used to get the current line number in the calling function.
member.remarks: This should be called in a parameter list to get accurate information about the line number before the Check* functions are called. If we wait until the Check* functions themselves to retrieve this information, then the stack trace indicates the next executable line, which is only marginally useful information. This function is compiled out in debug builds in favor of the LineNumber constant. Returns LineNumber, or 0 on failure.

member.name: M:ZKEShop.SystemFramework.ApplicationConfiguration.Create(System.Object,System.Object,System.Xml.XmlNode)
member.summary:
Called from OnApplicationStart to initialize settings from the Web.Config file(s).
The app domain will restart if settings change, so there is no reason to read these values more than once. This funtion uses the NameValueSectionHandler base class to generate a hashtablefrom the XML, which is then used to store the current settings. Because all settings are read here, we do not actually store the generated hashtable object for later retrieval by Context.GetConfig. The application should use the accessor functions directly.
An object created by processing a section with this name in a Config.Web file in a parent directory.
The config's context. The section to be read.
A ConfigOutput object: which we leave empty because all settings are stored at this point.
null: if there was an error.

member.name: M:ZKEShop.SystemFramework.ApplicationConfiguration.ReadSetting(System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
String version of ReadSetting.
Reads a setting from a hashtable and converts it to the correct type. One of these functions is provided for each type expected in the hash table. These are public so that other classes don't have to duplicate them to read settings from a hash table.
The Hashtable to read from. A key for the value in the Hashtable. The default value if the item is not found.
value: from the hash table
default: if the item is not in the table or cannot be case to the expected type.

member.name: M:ZKEShop.SystemFramework.ApplicationConfiguration.ReadSetting(System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Boolean version of ReadSetting.
Reads a setting from a hashtable and converts it to the correct type. One of these functions is provided for each type expected in the hash table. These are public so that other classes don't have to duplicate them to read settings from a hash table.
The Hashtable to read from. A key for the value in the Hashtable. The default value if the item is not found.
value: from the hash table
default: if the item is not in the table or cannot be case to the expected type.

member.name: M:ZKEShop.SystemFramework.ApplicationConfiguration.ReadSetting(System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
int version of ReadSetting.
Reads a setting from a hashtable and converts it to the correct type. One of these functions is provided for each type expected in the hash table. These are public so that other classes don't have to duplicate them to read settings from a hash table.
The Hashtable to read from. A key for the value in the Hashtable. The default value if the item is not found.
value: from the hash table
default: if the item is not in the table or cannot be case to the expected type.

member.name: M:ZKEShop.SystemFramework.ApplicationConfiguration.ReadSetting(System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection,System.String,System.Diagnostics.TraceLevel)
member.summary:
TraceLevel version of ReadSetting.
Reads a setting from a hashtable and converts it to the correct type. One of these functions is provided for each type expected in the hash table. These are public so that other classes don't have to duplicate them to read settings from a hash table.
The Hashtable to read from. A key for the value in the Hashtable. The default value if the item is not found.
value: from the hash table
default: if the item is not in the table or cannot be case to the expected type.

member.name: M:ZKEShop.SystemFramework.ApplicationConfiguration.OnApplicationStart(System.String)
member.summary: Function to be called by Application_OnStart as described in the class description. Initializes the application root. The path of the running application.

member.name: P:ZKEShop.SystemFramework.ApplicationConfiguration.ConnectionString
member.summary: create by wangpan 2010-08-18 应用程序连接字符串

member.name: P:ZKEShop.SystemFramework.ApplicationConfiguration.AppRoot
member.value: Property AppRoot is used to get the root path of the application.

member.name: P:ZKEShop.SystemFramework.ApplicationConfiguration.TracingEnabled
member.value: Property TracingEnabled is used to get the configuration setting, defaulting to False on error.

member.name: P:ZKEShop.SystemFramework.ApplicationConfiguration.TracingTraceFile
member.value: Property TracingTraceFile is used to get the full path name to the file that contains trace settings, defaults to ApplicationTrace.txt.

member.name: P:ZKEShop.SystemFramework.ApplicationConfiguration.TracingTraceLevel
member.value: Property TracingTraceFile is used to get the highest logging level that should be written to the tracing file, defaults to TraceLevel.Verbose (however, TracingEnabled defaults to False, so you have to turn it on explicitly).

member.name: P:ZKEShop.SystemFramework.ApplicationConfiguration.TracingSwitchName
member.value: Property TracingSwitchName is used to get the trace switch name, defaults to ApplicationTraceSwitch.

member.name: P:ZKEShop.SystemFramework.ApplicationConfiguration.TracingSwitchDescription
member.value: Property TracingSwitchDescription is used to get the trace settings file, defaults to "Application error and tracing information".

member.name: P:ZKEShop.SystemFramework.ApplicationConfiguration.EventLogEnabled
member.value: Property EventLogEnabled is used to get whether writing to the event log is support, defaults to True. Returns true if writing to the event log is enabled, false otherwise

member.name: P:ZKEShop.SystemFramework.ApplicationConfiguration.EventLogMachineName
member.value: Property EventLogMachineName is used to get the machine name to log the event to, defaults to an empty string, indicating the current machine. A machine name (without \\), may be empty.

member.name: P:ZKEShop.SystemFramework.ApplicationConfiguration.EventLogSourceName
member.value: Property EventLogMachineName is used to get the source of the error to be written to the event log, defaults WebApplication.

member.name: P:ZKEShop.SystemFramework.ApplicationConfiguration.EventLogTraceLevel
member.value: Property EventLogTraceLevel is used to get the highest logging level that should be written to the event log, defaults to TraceLevel.Error.

member.name: T:ZKEShop.SystemFramework.ApplicationLog
member.summary:
Logging class to provide tracing and logging support.
There are four different logging levels (error, warning, info, trace) that produce output to either the system event log or a tracing file as specified in the current ApplicationConfiguration settings.

member.name: M:ZKEShop.SystemFramework.ApplicationLog.WriteError(System.String)
member.summary: Write at the Error level to the event log and/or tracing file. The text to write to the log file or event log.

member.name: M:ZKEShop.SystemFramework.ApplicationLog.WriteWarning(System.String)
member.summary: Write at the Warning level to the event log and/or tracing file. The text to write to the log file or event log.

member.name: M:ZKEShop.SystemFramework.ApplicationLog.WriteInfo(System.String)
member.summary: Write at the Info level to the event log and/or tracing file. The text to write to the log file or event log.

member.name: M:ZKEShop.SystemFramework.ApplicationLog.WriteTrace(System.String)
member.summary: Write at the Verbose level to the event log and/or tracing file. The text to write to the log file or event log.

member.name: M:ZKEShop.SystemFramework.ApplicationLog.FormatException(System.Exception,System.String)
member.summary:
Write at the Verbose level to the event log and/or tracing file. The Exception object to format The string to prepend to the exception information.
A nicely format exception string, including message and StackTrace information.

member.name: M:ZKEShop.SystemFramework.ApplicationLog.WriteLog(System.Diagnostics.TraceLevel,System.String)
member.summary: Determine where a string needs to be written based on the configuration settings and the error level. The severity of the information to be logged. The string to be logged.

member.name: M:ZKEShop.SystemFramework.ApplicationLog.#cctor
member.summary: Constructor for ApplicationLog. Initialize all shared variables based on the ApplicationConfigurationsettings. Called when this class is first loaded.
